member.summary: Size of the new buffer, in bytes. This value must be 0 when creating a buffer with PrimaryBuffer set to true.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.DirectSound.BufferDescription.CanGetCurrentPosition
member.summary: Note that this flag affects only emulated sound cards. If a DirectSound driver is present, the play cursor is accurate for DirectSound in all versions of DirectX.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.DirectSound.BufferDescription.Control3D
member.summary: The buffer has 3-D control capability.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.DirectSound.BufferDescription.ControlEffects
member.summary: The buffer supports effects processing.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.DirectSound.BufferDescription.ControlFrequency
member.summary: The buffer has frequency control capability.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.DirectSound.BufferDescription.ControlPan
member.summary: The buffer has pan control capability. Cannot be combined with Control3D.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.DirectSound.BufferDescription.ControlPositionNotify
member.summary: The buffer has position notification capability.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.DirectSound.BufferDescription.ControlVolume
member.summary: The buffer has volume control capability.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.DirectSound.BufferDescription.DeferLocation
member.summary: The buffer can be assigned to a hardware or software resource at play time. This flag must be set for buffers that use voice management.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.DirectSound.BufferDescription.Flags
member.summary: Flags specifying the capabilities of the buffer.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.DirectSound.BufferDescription.Format
member.summary: Structure specifying the waveform format for the buffer.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.DirectSound.BufferDescription.GlobalFocus
member.summary: The buffer is a global sound buffer. With this flag set, an application using DirectSound can continue to play its buffers if the user switches focus to another application, even if the new application uses DirectSound. The one exception is if you switch focus to a DirectSound application that uses the WritePrimary flag for its cooperative level. In this case, the global sounds from other applications will not be audible.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.DirectSound.BufferDescription.Guid3DAlgorithm
member.summary: Unique identifier of the two-speaker virtualization algorithm to be used by DirectSound3D hardware emulation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.DirectSound.BufferDescription.LocateInHardware
member.summary: The buffer must use hardware mixing, If the device does not support hardware mixing or if the required hardware memory is not available, the method will fail.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.DirectSound.BufferDescription.LocateInSoftware
member.summary: The buffer must be in software memory and use software mixing, even if Static is specified and hardware resources are available.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.DirectSound.BufferDescription.Mute3DAtMaximumDistance
member.summary: The sound is reduced to silence at the maximum distance. The buffer will stop playing when the maximum distance is exceeded, so that processor time is not wasted. Applies only to software buffers.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.DirectSound.BufferDescription.PrimaryBuffer
member.summary: The buffer is a primary buffer. If this value is not specified, a secondary sound buffer is created.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.DirectSound.BufferDescription.StaticBuffer
member.summary: The buffer is placed in on-board hardware memory, if available. No error occurs if such memory is not available. This flag has no effect on cards using the PCI bus. Cannot be combined with ControlEffects.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.DirectSound.BufferDescription.StickyFocus
member.summary: The buffer has sticky focus. If the user switches to another application not using DirectSound, the application's normal buffers are muted, but sticky focus buffers are still audible.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.DirectSound.DSoundHelper.Guid3DAlgorithmHrtfFull
member.summary: The 3-D API is processed with the high quality 3-D audio algorithm. This algorithm gives the highest quality 3-D audio effect, but uses more CPU cycles.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.DirectSound.DSoundHelper.Guid3DAlgorithmHrtfLight
member.summary: The 3-D API is processed with the efficient 3-D audio algorithm. This algorithm gives a good 3-D audio effect, but uses fewer CPU cycles than Guid3DAlgorithmHrtfFull

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.DirectSound.DSoundHelper.Guid3DAlgorithmNoVirtualization
member.summary: 3-D output is mapped onto normal left and right stereo panning. At 90 degrees to the left, the sound is coming out of only the left speaker; at 90 degrees to the right, sound is coming out of only the right speaker. The vertical axis is ignored except for scaling of volume due to distance. Doppler shift and volume scaling are still applied, but the 3-D filtering is not performed on this buffer. This is the most efficient software implementation, but provides no virtual 3-D audio effect.

member.summary: The buffer is a global sound buffer. With this flag set, an application using DirectSound can continue to play its buffers if the user switches focus to another application, even if the new application uses DirectSound.

member.summary: The buffer uses hardware mixing.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.DirectSound.BufferCaps.Mute3DAtMaximumDistance
member.summary: The sound is reduced to silence at the maximum distance. The buffer will stop playing when the maximum distance is exceeded, so that processor time is not wasted. Applies only to software buffers.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.DirectSound.BufferCaps.PlayCpuOverhead
member.summary: The processing overhead as a percentage of main processor cycles needed to mix this sound buffer. For hardware buffers, this member will be zero because the mixing is performed by the sound device. For software buffers, this member depends on the buffer format and the speed of the system processor.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.DirectSound.BufferCaps.PrimaryBuffer
member.summary: The buffer is a primary buffer.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.DirectSound.BufferCaps.StaticBuffer
member.summary: The buffer is in on-board hardware memory.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.DirectSound.BufferCaps.StickyFocus
member.summary: The buffer has sticky focus. If the user switches to another application not using DirectSound, the buffer is still audible. However, if the user switches to another DirectSound application, the buffer is muted.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.DirectSound.BufferCaps.UnlockTransferRate
member.summary: The rate, in kilobytes per second, at which data is transferred to the buffer memory when Buffer.Read or Buffer.Write is called.
